update.description:
related to issue #900. It provides a workaround in the form of a plugin for achieving the same result. 

The proper fix is to support making `<light>` a child of `<link>` which involves updating the sdf description.

jenkins: 

[xenial-nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/74/) - ok

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/API_ABI_report/) - ok

`worlds/attach_lights.world`:

![attach_lights.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/957984617-attach_lights.jpg)

pull_request.title: Add plugin for attaching lights to links in a model

pullrequest.title: Add plugin for attaching lights to links in a model

content.raw:
I'm always a bit worried about using pose addition because of issue #216. I try to always convert poses to homogeneous matrices so the meaning of operations is clear.

Having that said, the addition here seems to be doing the right thing, so I don't think it's *necessary* to change it.
content.html:
I'm always a bit worried about using pose addition because of issue #216. I try to always convert poses to homogeneous matrices so the meaning of operations is clear.

Having that said, the addition here seems to be doing the right thing, so I don't think it's necessary to change it.
